Girl Scouts nvesiure
Church. Fri. May %. Troop 7l2 presented.


Mrs. Marie Thomas junior leader and Mrs. Veronica
is cadete leader.


Rev. L. K. Williams. pastor presented short talk


Pictured the Girl Scouts service Mrs. Sacdo, cadee
leader. Mrs. c. Thomas. Mrs. Colbert Crystal
Mrs. B. Weber, Rev. l.. K. Williams, Bertha Sacdo
Whitfield Gail Wade Clara Watkins Rosemary MITCHELL

MIAMI, Florida A Negro
teacher was reinstated after his
suspension for pulling switch
blade knife on a group of young
thugs who broke into his junior
high school class last February.


Cecil j. Harris stated he had
acted in self defense when a tough
group entered the school, an all

Teacher Reinsfufed After
Suspension In Fig hit

Dodowah, Ghana----"I never
dreamed l would be doing push
ups at $3.50 in the morning, and by
flashlight at that" said Ford T.
Johnson. school sportsmaster at
Chanata Secondary School.


Johns on, a Peace Corps volun-
teer from Richmond, Virginia.
is a graduate of Virginia Union
University and former student
at Atlanta's Morehouse College.


In addition to the sports pro-
gram, he teaches classroom
chemistry and mathematics.


The twenty-two-year-oldVir-
ginian has built sports stadium,
composed of an oval track with
field facilities for broad and high
jumping, and a basketball court.
He was so eager to finish his
project. he worked through last
summers vacation to put on
the finishing touches.


He enjoys teaching and is fond
of the students. "They are highly
receptive" he says, although
they're Independent about any
thing they don't like. Like STU
dents everywhere else. they are
a bit lazy at times" he added.


Last year he concentrated on
teaching maths" as it is called.
This year. he is specializing in
chemistry courses.


In addition to these RESPONSE
bilities, the enthusiastic Peace
Corpsman organized the Ghana
School Cultural Society Club
which participates in dancing.
plays, debates and other activi-
ties for broadening the students
horizon on world affairs.


Johnson likes dramatics and Is
a member Of Accra, Ghana's
Players Guild. He recently
played Walter Lee in their pre-
sentation of "Raisin in the Sum-"


Johns on is happy to be inG hana.
cts a great feeling to be in a
developing country making sig
nificant contribution to its
growth" he says enthusiastic
ally.


"This experience Is rewarding
in so many ways. The travel is
broadening my perspective and
creating a different sense of
values for me-" he adds. From
another part of the world. one
can see America from the outside
and get a total view of the home
land. Actually. 1t makes you want
to see more of the world.


IL haven't regretted moment
of this opportunity"


Johnson is one of more than
1000 Peace Corps Volunteers in
46 countries throughout the
world.

Former Musician
Teaching N 9th


In Peace Corps

Negro one, and threatened pupils.


The teacher said one of the gang
looked like twenty-five year old
criminal.


The school board voted unani-
mously to reinstate Harris. The
boards attorney. G. A. Bolles
said he had gone too gar in his
actions.
